docs.text: field of dreams almost defies description .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it's about baseball , it's not a baseball movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although the film is extremely spiritual , it's not about religion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and although field of dreams is melodramatic , it's not a tearjerker .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to really understand what field of dreams is all about , you have to see it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the film , kevin costner plays ray kinsella , a baseball fan , '60s berkeley graduate , and iowa farmer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one day as he is standing in the middle of his expansive corn fields , ray hears a voice ; it tells him : " if you build it , he will come . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: then ray has a vision and somehow concludes that if he builds a baseball field in the middle of his corn , shoeless joe jackson will arise from the dead to play ball once again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and even though it depletes his family's savings and his neighbors think he's crazy , ray clears away the corn and builds a baseball field , complete with bleachers and flood lights .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " if you build it , he will come . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and lo and behold , shoeless joe does come--bringing with him several of his dead teammates .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then ray hears the voice again ; it tells him to " ease his pain . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ray thinks this means that he must travel to boston to meet terence mann , an influential and radical novelist from the '60s who has since stopped writing and dropped out of society .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with great aplomb , james earl jones plays the disillusioned author who joins forces with ray and embarks with him on a magical and spiritual journey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the cast in field of dreams is excellent , especially kevin costner in the lead role .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: costner gives a quiet , subtle , and moving performance as a man who before building the baseball field had done nothing crazy or spontaneous in his entire life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: costner gives ray just the right mix of enthusiasm and idealism to make us believe in his mystic visions and swallow this wondrous fairy tale .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: amy madigan gives a fine supporting performance as ray's feisty and loving wife , who against her better judgement supports her husband's crazy ideas .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in her most impressive scene , madigan vehemently argues against book burning at a p . t . a .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: meeting , displaying the sincere passion of a '60s berkeley radical .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ray liotta is appropriately eerie and awe-inspiring as the ghost of shoeless joe , the legendary batter who was suspended from baseball for his involvement in the 1919 chicago " black sox " scandal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and finally , burt lancaster is memorable in a small , but important , role as a small town doctor whose professional baseball career was limited to only one inning .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: field of dreams is a touching fairy tale full of life , wonder , mystery , spirit , and humor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it , for the most part , succeeds in capturing our emotions and suspending our disbelief .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ray kinsella's spiritual quest in pursuit of his dreams proves to be moving and miraculous .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but while field of dreams generally avoids excessive melodrama , it unfortunately does at times go overboard , and by the end it gets down-right sappy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in general , however , field of dreams is an emotionally satisfying fantasy--one i can recommend to everyone but unromantic cynics .
docs.label: positive
